---
slug: /124
title: "This Week In React #124: FLIP, Lifecycle, Next.js, TypeScript, Vanilla-Extract, LiveView, Remix, GitHub, Race Conditions, Fontpie, Remotion..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 11-15-2022
---
Hi everyone!
After a few intense weeks, the React ecosystem slows down a bit in terms of major announcements.

translations.fr: Apr√®s quelques semaines intenses, l'√©cosyst√®me React ralentit l√©g√®rement en termes d'annonces majeures.

segments.source_content: We still have some very good articles coming out. The TypeScript plugin for Next.js looks awesome!

translations.fr: Nous avons tout de m√™me de tr√®s bons articles qui sortent. Le plugin TypeScript pour Next.js semble formidable !
translations.en: Nous avons encore de tr√®s bons articles qui sortent. Le plugin TypeScript pour Next.js semble g√©nial !

segments.source_content: The GitHub Universe conference has ended. GitHub seems to be using React more and more, on some views, and also via GitHub Blocks based on MDX.

translations.fr: La conf√©rence GitHub Universe s'est termin√©e. GitHub semble utiliser React de plus en plus, sur certaines vues, et √©galement via les GitHub Blocks bas√©s sur MDX.

segments.source_content: [FlyCode](https://bit.ly/3wWSi00) (YC S22) makes React web apps editable in minutes so Product and UX teams can iterate and release products faster, so they don't have to wait on (or consume) developer time.

translations.fr: [FlyCode](https://bit.ly/3wWSi00) (YC S22) rend les applications web React modifiables en quelques minutes afin que les √©quipes Produit et UX puissent it√©rer et publier des produits plus rapidement, sans attendre (ou consommer) le temps des d√©veloppeurs.
translations.en: [FlyCode](https://bit.ly/3wWSi00) (YC S22) rend les applications web React modifiables en quelques minutes, permettant aux √©quipes Produit et UX d'it√©rer et de publier plus rapidement, sans attendre (ou consommer) le temps des d√©veloppeurs.

segments.source_content: FlyCode reads your regular React code and finds Texts, Images, Design tokens and Analytics event, then it let's non-coders collaborate and edit them and send back a pull request (they don't need access to GitHub!)

translations.fr: FlyCode lit votre code React standard et identifie les textes, images, jetons de conception et √©v√©nements d'analyse, puis permet aux non-d√©veloppeurs de collaborer pour les modifier et soumettre une pull request (sans n√©cessiter d'acc√®s GitHub !).
translations.en: FlyCode lit votre code React standard, identifie les textes, images, jetons de design et √©v√©nements d'analyse, puis permet aux non-codeurs de collaborer, de les modifier et d'envoyer une pull request (sans acc√®s √† GitHub !).

segments.source_content:
- Saves development time
- No code integration, it just reads your code!
- GitHub based, a bot is scanning the code and creates pull requests
- Use your own stack and components
- Retain codebase ownership

translations.fr:
- √âconomise du temps de d√©veloppement
- Int√©gration sans code, il lit simplement votre code !
- Bas√© sur GitHub, un bot scanne le code et cr√©e des pull requests
- Utilisez votre propre pile et composants
- Conservez la propri√©t√© de la base de code
translations.en:
- √âconomise du temps de d√©veloppement
- Int√©gration sans code, il lit simplement votre code !
- Bas√© sur GitHub, un bot scanne le code et cr√©e des pull requests
- Utilisez votre propre stack et composants
- Gardez la propri√©t√© de votre base de code

segments.source_content: You can get started here: [flycode.com/developers](https://www.flycode.com/developers)
## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}
[![Inside Framer's Magic Motion](/emails/issues/124/framer-motion.png)](https://www.nan.fyi/magic-motion)

translations.fr: [![Dans les coulisses de Magic Motion de Framer](/emails/issues/124/framer-motion.png)](https://www.nan.fyi/magic-motion)

segments.source_content: **[Inside Framer's Magic Motion](https://www.nan.fyi/magic-motion)**

translations.fr: **[Dans les coulisses de Magic Motion de Framer](https://www.nan.fyi/magic-motion)**

segments.source_content: A great interactive article that explains what a layout animation is. It greatly deconstructs the FLIP technique which allows to make this kind of transition perform better via CSS transforms (position, scale). We recreate the layout animation system of Framer Motion step by step.

translations.fr: Un excellent article interactif expliquant ce qu'est une animation de mise en page. Il d√©construit magistralement la technique FLIP qui am√©liore les performances de ce type de transition via les transformations CSS (position, √©chelle). Nous recr√©ons pas √† pas le syst√®me d'animation de mise en page de Framer Motion.
translations.en: Un excellent article interactif qui explique ce qu'est une animation de mise en page. Il d√©construit brillamment la technique FLIP qui permet d'optimiser ce type de transition via les transformations CSS (position, √©chelle). Nous recr√©ons pas √† pas le syst√®me d'animation de mise en page de Framer Motion.

segments.source_content: On the same subject, I recommend to read also [Everything about Framer Motion layout animations](https://blog.maximeheckel.com/posts/framer-motion-layout-animations/).

translations.fr: Sur le m√™me sujet, je recommande √©galement la lecture de [Tout sur les animations de mise en page avec Framer Motion](https://blog.maximeheckel.com/posts/framer-motion-layout-animations/).
translations.en: Sur le m√™me sujet, je recommande aussi de lire [Tout sur les animations de mise en page de Framer Motion](https://blog.maximeheckel.com/posts/framer-motion-layout-animations/).

segments.source_content: [![Timeline of a React Component With Hooks](/emails/issues/124/timeline.jpg)](https://julesblom.com/writing/react-hook-component-timeline)
**[Timeline of a React Component With Hooks](https://julesblom.com/writing/react-hook-component-timeline)**

An interactive diagram that demonstrates the lifecycle of a React component, including hooks, refs, and DOM updates/paint (not available on mobile). Also includes a quiz to test your knowledge, and many quotes/references.

translations.fr: Un diagramme interactif d√©montrant le cycle de vie d'un composant React, incluant hooks, refs et mises √† jour/rendu DOM (non disponible sur mobile). Comprend √©galement un quiz pour tester vos connaissances et de nombreuses citations/r√©f√©rences.
translations.en: Un diagramme interactif d√©montrant le cycle de vie d'un composant React, incluant les hooks, les refs, et les mises √† jour/rendu du DOM (non disponible sur mobile). Comprend aussi un quiz pour tester vos connaissances et de nombreuses citations/r√©f√©rences.

segments.source_content: [![Next.js 13](/emails/issues/124/nextjs13ts.jpg)](https://twitter.com/delba_oliveira/status/1592209522281439232)
**[Next.js 13 TypeScript Plugin](https://twitter.com/delba_oliveira/status/1592209522281439232)**

Shu Ding is working on a TypeScript language service plugin ([source](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/blob/canary/packages/next/server/next-typescript.ts)) that significantly improves Next.js DX by bringing docs, new errors and autocompletion on top of Next.js and Server Components conventions. This compensates nicely the [inability to type exports from an ES module](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/38511) in TypeScript, a feature much requested by framework authors.

translations.fr: Shu Ding travaille sur un plugin de service de langage TypeScript ([source](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/blob/canary/packages/next/server/next-typescript.ts)) qui am√©liore significativement l'exp√©rience d√©veloppeur (DX) de Next.js en apportant de la documentation, de nouvelles erreurs et de l'auto-compl√©tion bas√©es sur les conventions de Next.js et des Server Components. Cela compense agr√©ablement l'[incapacit√© √† typer les exports d'un module ES](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/38511) dans TypeScript, une fonctionnalit√© tr√®s demand√©e par les auteurs de frameworks.
translations.en: Shu Ding travaille sur un plugin de service de langage TypeScript ([source](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/blob/canary/packages/next/server/next-typescript.ts)) qui am√©liore significativement la DX de Next.js en apportant de la documentation, de nouvelles erreurs et de l'auto-compl√©tion bas√©es sur les conventions Next.js et Server Components. Cela compense efficacement l'[impossibilit√© de typer les exports d'un module ES](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/38511) dans TypeScript, une fonctionnalit√© tr√®s demand√©e par les auteurs de frameworks.

segments.source_content: [![Writing Performant CSS with vanilla-extract](/emails/issues/124/vanilla-extract.png)](https://www.lekoarts.de/javascript/writing-performant-css-with-vanilla-extract)
**[Writing Performant CSS with vanilla-extract](https://www.lekoarts.de/javascript/writing-performant-css-with-vanilla-extract)**

An exhaustive article about [vanilla-extract](https://vanilla-extract.style/), the no-runtime CSS-in-JS library based on TypeScript by Mark Dalgleish (creator of CSS Modules). Mention also its atomic CSS overlay [Sprinkles](https://vanilla-extract.style/documentation/packages/sprinkles/). Examples based on React: reproduction of a Tailwind UI component. Many comparisons with Tailwind and other CSS-in-JS solutions. Well, it looks powerful, but not so simple indeed üòÖ We'll have to study this further.

translations.fr: Un article exhaustif sur [vanilla-extract](https://vanilla-extract.style/), la biblioth√®que CSS-in-JS sans runtime bas√©e sur TypeScript par Mark Dalgleish (cr√©ateur de CSS Modules). Mentionne √©galement sa surcouche CSS atomique [Sprinkles](https://vanilla-extract.style/documentation/packages/sprinkles/). Exemples bas√©s sur React : reproduction d'un composant Tailwind UI. De nombreuses comparaisons avec Tailwind et d'autres solutions CSS-in-JS. Eh bien, cela semble puissant, mais pas si simple en effet üòÖ Nous devrons √©tudier cela plus avant.
translations.en: Un article exhaustif sur [vanilla-extract](https://vanilla-extract.style/), la biblioth√®que CSS-in-JS sans runtime bas√©e sur TypeScript par Mark Dalgleish (cr√©ateur de CSS Modules). Mentionne √©galement sa surcouche CSS atomique [Sprinkles](https://vanilla-extract.style/documentation/packages/sprinkles/). Exemples bas√©s sur React : reproduction d'un composant Tailwind UI. Nombreuses comparaisons avec Tailwind et d'autres solutions CSS-in-JS. Eh bien, cela semble puissant mais pas si simple üòÖ Nous devrons √©tudier cela plus avant.

segments.source_content:
- üìñ React beta docs: [class component API ref (WIP)](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1592262830304251908)
- üêô [GitHub UI using React](https://twitter.com/rauchg/status/1591464351990697984) ([Hacker News thread](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=33576722)): GitHub seems to use React more and more. They also have a React design system: [Primer React](https://primer.style/react/). The upcoming feature [GitHub Blocks](https://blocks.githubnext.com/) which allows to make the README interactive is also [implemented with MDX](https://twitter.com/idangazit/status/1590726137638195200)
- üìú [Fetching data in React: the case of lost Promises](https://www.developerway.com/posts/fetching-in-react-lost-promises): well-illustrated interactive article on the race conditions that can occur when making requests. Gives several techniques to avoid them. I also wrote an [article](https://sebastienlorber.com/handling-api-request-race-conditions-in-react) on the subject üòú (both are worth reading, quite complementary)
- üìú [A Love Letter to React](https://fly.io/blog/love-letter-react/): the creator of Phoenix (Elixir framework) explains how he was inspired by React to create LiveView: a solution to add interactivity on server-side rendered HTML. LiveView reminds me a lot of Remix!
- üìú [Open Development for Remix](https://remix.run/blog/open-development): Remix wants the project to be community driven. Everything becomes public: [roadmap](https://github.com/orgs/remix-run/projects/5/views/1)/process, and planning meetings streamed on Youtube.
- üìú [Type-safe environment variables on both client and server with Remix](https://dev.to/gugaguichard/type-safe-environment-variables-on-both-client-and-server-with-remix-54l5): interesting solution parsing env variables with Zod and exposing some of them to the client, including type-safety and autocomplete.
- üìú [Chromatic - Interaction tests for user behavior](https://www.chromatic.com/blog/interaction-tests-for-user-behavior/): Storybook interaction tests are now integrated with Chromatic SaaS
- üìú [React Server vs Client components in Next.js 13](https://kulkarniankita.com/react/react-server-client-components)
- üìú [What is a state manager](https://www.reatom.dev/general/what-is-state-manager)
- üìú [A novel schema-first approach to building forms](https://www.vazco.eu/blog/a-novel-schema-first-approach-to-building-forms)
- üìú [Creating fluffy trees with Three.js (part 1)](https://douges.dev/blog/threejs-trees-1)
- üìä [I compared deploy speeds for Reflame, Vercel, Netlify, Cloudflare Pages on the same repo](https://blog.reflame.app/i-compared-deploy-speeds-for-reflame-vercel-netlify-cloudflare-pages-on-the-same-repo): the marketing around "instant deploy" is not always true.
- üí∞ [Remotion - We raised CHF 180k to simplify programmatic video!](https://www.remotion.dev/blog/seed-funding): I bring my modest contribution ü§≠
- üê¶ [Comparison between Next.js 12 and the Next.js 13 experimental `app` dir!](https://twitter.com/lydiahallie/status/1591120215189749760)
- üó£ [RemixConf 2023 CFP Open](https://twitter.com/remix_run/status/1590513919902507008)
- üì¶ [Fontpie](https://github.com/pixel-point/fontpie): new CLI solution to avoid custom font layout shifts (see this [demo](https://twitter.com/alex_barashkov/status/1590329974409469952) to understand). It makes techniques used in `next/font` framework-agnostic.
- üì¶ [Remix-Vite](https://github.com/sudomf/remix-vite): adds Hot Module Replacement support to Remix
- üì¶ [craco 7.0](https://github.com/dilanx/craco/releases/tag/v7.0.0): allows to customize CRA - CRA v5 support
- üì¶ [Redwood 3.3](https://github.com/redwoodjs/redwood/releases/tag/v3.3.0)
- üì¶ [Rockpack 3.0 - create-react-app on steroids + SSR](https://github.com/AlexSergey/rockpack)

segments.source_content: refine seamlessly works with any custom design or UI framework you favor. For convenience, it ships with ready-made integrations for Ant Design, Material UI, Mantine, and Chakra UI. It eliminates the repetitive tasks demanded by CRUD operations and provides industry-standard solutions for critical parts like authentication, access control, routing, networking, state management, and i18n.

translations.fr: refine fonctionne de mani√®re transparente avec n'importe quel design personnalis√© ou framework d'interface que vous pr√©f√©rez. Pour plus de commodit√©, il est livr√© avec des int√©grations pr√™tes √† l'emploi pour Ant Design, Material UI, Mantine et Chakra UI. Il √©limine les t√¢ches r√©p√©titives exig√©es par les op√©rations CRUD et fournit des solutions standardis√©es pour des parties critiques comme l'authentification, le contr√¥le d'acc√®s, le routage, le r√©seau, la gestion d'√©tat et l'i18n.
translations.en: refine fonctionne parfaitement avec n'importe quel design personnalis√© ou framework UI que vous pr√©f√©rez. Pour plus de commodit√©, il inclut des int√©grations pr√™tes √† l'emploi pour Ant Design, Material UI, Mantine et Chakra UI. Il √©limine les t√¢ches r√©p√©titives des op√©rations CRUD et fournit des solutions standard pour des parties critiques comme l'authentification, le contr√¥le d'acc√®s, le routage, le r√©seau, la gestion d'√©tat et l'i18n.

It's quite related to the idea of having [React-Native Server Components](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1585058874864062466).

segments.source_content: ## üßë‚Äçüíª Jobs {#jobs}

üßë‚Äçüíº [**Product Engineer at Causal, Remote/London/NY, $150-250k**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)

Causal is a Series A Startup (backed by Coatue/Accel) building an all-in-one tool for working with numbers and visualizing data. We're looking for strong React engineers who can solve difficult UX/performance challenges.

translations.fr: Causal est une startup de s√©rie A (soutenue par Coatue/Accel) qui construit un outil tout-en-un pour manipuler des nombres et visualiser des donn√©es. Nous recherchons des ing√©nieurs React exp√©riment√©s capables de r√©soudre des d√©fis complexes d'UX et de performance.

segments.source_content: üßë‚Äçüíº [**G2i - 100% Remote React Native Jobs**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)

We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is ~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.

segments.source_content: üí° [How to publish an offer?](https://thisweekinreact.com/sponsor)
## üîÄ Other {#other}

- [TypeScript 4.9](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-4-9/): with satisfies!
- [TypeScript satisfies operator](https://tomdohnal.com/posts/typescript-satisfies-keyword): another example of using satisfies
- [Qwik Showcase](https://qwik.builder.io/showcase/): great Lighthouse scores
- [Introducing SolidStart: The SolidJS Framework](https://www.solidjs.com/blog/introducing-solidstart): the SolidJS meta-framework SolidJS is now in beta. It takes some React ecosystem inspirations and bring some novel ideas. See also [Fireship - A Solid Start](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DVWu2b7mvFg)
- [Parcel 2.8](https://twitter.com/devongovett/status/1590378157747875840): great improvements around bundling, perf, HMR, code splitting...
- [Deno 1.28 - Featuring 1.3 Million New Modules](https://deno.com/blog/v1.28): npm compatibility with security in mind. See also this [video](https://twitter.com/deno_land/status/1592274094963462144).
- [The evolution of scalable CSS](https://frontendmastery.com/posts/the-evolution-of-scalable-css/): nice retrospective of the evolution of CSS techniques, including CSS-in-JS popularized by React
- [Why would anyone need JavaScript generator functions?](https://jrsinclair.com/articles/2022/why-would-anyone-need-javascript-generator-functions/)
- [Stylify - Write CSS Faster](https://stylifycss.com/)
- [Everything new from GitHub Universe 2022](https://github.blog/2022-11-09-everything-new-from-github-universe-2022/)
- [Octoverse 2022 - The state of open source software](https://octoverse.github.com/)
- [Forking Chrome to turn HTML into SVG](https://fathy.fr/html2svg)
- [This week in stc, 1](https://kdy1.dev/posts/2022/11/stc-update-1)
- [Change Array By Copy in Chromium](https://twitter.com/robpalmer2/status/1591174422802890754)
- [ultrahtml 1.0](https://github.com/natemoo-re/ultrahtml)
- [Announcing Cypress Component Testing GA and Performance Improvements in Cypress 11](https://www.cypress.io/blog/2022/11/08/announcing-cypress-11/)
- [GreenFrame - measure the carbon footprint of websites](https://marmelab.com/blog/2022/11/09/greenframe-open-source.html)
- [Doctolib - 10 lessons I learned owning on a Design System for 30+ Product Designers and 200+ Developers](https://medium.com/doctolib/10-lessons-i-learned-owning-on-a-design-system-for-30-product-designers-and-200-developers-c2986e4dbb6f)
- [Node.js Security Best Practices](https://nodejs.org/en/docs/guides/security/)
